verbs.description: oversleep (third-person singular simple present oversleeps, present participle oversleeping, simple past and past participle overslept)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To sleep for longer than intended. [from 14th c.]
examples: I overslept and was late for school.

entries.meaning: (reflexive, now rare) To sleep for longer than one intended. [from 15th c.]
examples: Theodore made awkward excuses, and attributed his delay to having overslept himself.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To sleep beyond (a given time), to sleep through (an event etc.). [from 16th c.]
examples: to oversleep one's usual hour of rising
